how does glue work glue is actually a

firstly let's ditch the term glue

types prefer the term adhesives so

several categories of adhesive they can
be reactive relying on a chemical

nonreactive not relying on a chemical

be drying adhesives pressure adhesives
contact adhesives multi-part adhesives
and natural adhesives the first
adhesives were of course completely
natural and made from anything that
happened to be sticky so beeswax jam tar
bogeys then came more complex chemical
adhesives most famously animal glue and
these were made by boiling up whatever
was left on the slaughterhouse floor
when everything else has gone into the

like billions and billions of

one nanometers that's a ten billionth of

mechanical locking the theory here is
that any apparently perfectly smooth
surface a sheet of glass a pool ball
David Cameron's face is actually very
rough when viewed at a microscopic level
the adhesive therefore works by flowing
into these imperfections unlocking into
